title: Change site/app name across branding and metadata

requirements.text: Change the website/app name from "AutoGleam Supply" to "TorqueShine Supply" and update all user-facing branding text to match across the frontend (header/logo alt text, About section heading/body copy, footer copyright, and HTML document title).
acceptanceCriteria: The header brand name text shows "TorqueShine Supply".
The header logo image alt text uses "TorqueShine Supply".
The About section heading and any body copy that mentions "AutoGleam Supply" are updated to "TorqueShine Supply".
The footer copyright line displays "© <currentYear> TorqueShine Supply. All rights reserved.".
frontend/index.html <title> is updated to start with "TorqueShine Supply".
No remaining visible occurrences of "AutoGleam Supply" exist in the UI.

requirements.text: Centralize the site/app name in a single frontend constant/module and refactor all components that display the site name to use that constant so future renames do not require hunting for duplicated strings.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a single source of truth for the site/app name used by header, footer, about section, and document title.
Renaming the app requires changing the name in only one place in the frontend codebase.
Build passes with no TypeScript errors.

requirements.text: Update the footer’s non-browser fallback identifier string (used for the caffeine.ai attribution URL parameter) to a slug that matches the new name (e.g., "torqueshine-supply").
acceptanceCriteria: When window is undefined, the footer attribution URL uses the updated fallback slug based on "TorqueShine Supply".

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not edit any paths listed in frontend immutablePaths.
Keep the backend unchanged; this request is branding-only.
nonGoals: Changing product catalog data, brands, or product content.
Generating new logo/hero images or changing existing generated asset filenames.
Adding new pages, navigation items, or authentication changes.
